poem:
Title: "A Shared Power, Rising"

Two seasons passed under the harrow's edge,
Parliament waits, its hardy heart allegiant.
Saturday beckons, Stormont's loyal pledge,
A dance with history, graciously defiant.

O'Neill ascends the nationalist vanguard,
An echo of progress, the first of her kind.
Unbraiding the conflict, a path forward,
In her hands, a visions' ties do bind.

Hope weaves anew on Northern Ireland's course,
In power shared, lies strength and peaceful force.
